sections.heading: Short title.  This Article may be cited as the Ensuring a More Qualified, Competent, and Diverse Community Behavioral Health Workforce Act
sections.text: References in this Article to "this Act" mean this Article.

sections.heading: Findings.  The General Assembly finds that:
sections.text: Findings. The General Assembly finds that:

sections.heading: Grant awards.  To develop and enhance professional development opportunities and diversity in the behavioral health field, and increase access to quality care, the Department of Human Services, Division of Mental Health, shall award grants or contracts to community mental health centers or behaviora
sections.text: Grant awards. To develop and enhance professional development opportunities and diversity in the behavioral health field, and increase access to quality care, the Department of Human Services, Division of Mental Health, shall award grants or contracts to community mental health centers or behavioral health clinics licensed or certified by the Department of Human Services or the Department of Healthcare and Family Services to establish or enhance training and supervision of interns and behavioral health providers-in-training pursuing licensure as a licensed clinical social worker, licensed clinical professional counselor, and licensed marriage and family therapist.

sections.heading: Use of funds. An eligible entity receiving a grant or contract under this Act shall use funds received through the grant or contract to establish new, or enhance existing, training, and supervision of interns and behavioral health providers-in-training pursuing licensure as a licensed clinical socia
sections.text: Use of funds. An eligible entity receiving a grant or contract under this Act shall use funds received through the grant or contract to establish new, or enhance existing, training, and supervision of interns and behavioral health providers-in-training pursuing licensure as a licensed clinical social worker, licensed clinical professional counselor, and licensed marriage and family therapist.

sections.heading: Priority. In awarding grants and contracts under this Act, the Department of Human Services, Division of Mental Health, shall give priority to eligible entities in underserved urban areas and rural areas of the State
sections.text: Priority. In awarding grants and contracts under this Act, the Department of Human Services, Division of Mental Health, shall give priority to eligible entities in underserved urban areas and rural areas of the State.

sections.heading: Grant terms. A grant or contract awarded under this Act shall be for a period of 3 years
sections.text: Nothing in the Act precludes grantees to reapply for additional rounds of funding.

sections.heading: Application submission. An entity seeking a grant or contract under this Act shall submit an application at such time, in such manner, and accompanied by such information as the Department of Human Services, Division of Mental Health, may require
